Hi John,

It is most likely not a single menuki, but it is an applied piece=
. The ruler
is the type used in calligraphy and is a common late Muromachi =
to Momoyama
period design. It is a rather nice piece. Goto kiri mon have id=
entifying
punch marks, but your photos are too small to confirm them.

Gord=
on

I have read somewhere - I cannot remember w=
here - that Goto menuki 
have sometimes been mounted as the decoration on k=
odzuka or kogai.  Is 
the kodzuka illustrated in my photo album JPL one suc=
h?

It is of good quality shakudo, with a worn, horizontal nanako surface 
=
within a raised rim.  The decoration is a raised shakudo boss with a 
circu=
mferential nanako decoration.  This rests upon a gold base, and 
depicts si=
x pawlonia mon of the 3-5-3 variety, with a seventh set deep 
at the centre=
.  This one is less worn than the other six, and is very 
detailed in its e=
xecution.  The whole sits upon a silver ?shuttle.  
The reverse is of polis=
hed shakudo, and the kodzuka is unsigned.

See http://tinyurl.com/77rxt

Re=
gards and thanks, John L.
